active_learning.discussion_prompt: How would you apply this concept in your work environment?
active_learning.peer_teaching: In pairs, one explains JIT vs. permanent roles in ARA (using NIST SP 800-162 attributes), then switch for teach-back. Peers quiz each other on enforcement of least privilege.
active_learning.problem_solving: Design ARA rules for a hospital scenario: Assign roles to doctors/nurses based on attributes (shift, department, patient sensitivity) to enforce least privilege. Solve for edge cases like emergencies, then peer-review for NIST compliance.

distractor_protocol.step: Distractor 1: Common misconception (e.g., ARA eliminates all human oversight).
Distractor 2: Partial truth/overgeneralization (e.g., RBAC always static, ignoring hybrid models).
Distractor 3: Plausible opposite (e.g., JIT provides permanent access vs. temporary).

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in university-level pedagogy (Bloom's Taxonomy, active learning, scaffolding). Generate 30 high-quality flashcards on 'Automated Role Assignment (ARA)' in the topic hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Asset Security > Asset Provisioning > Identity and Access Provisioning > Automated Identity Provisioning > Automated Role Assignment. **Completed Research Context:** Automated Role Assignment (ARA) automates granting roles/permissions based on rules/attributes, enhancing IAM efficiency and security. Core Concepts: Role (permissions set); ARA (auto-assignment via policies); IAM (right access framework); ABAC (attribute-based: user/resource/action/environment); RBAC (role-based); JIT Access (temporary privileges). Standards: - NIST SP 800-162: ABAC Implementation Guide – Policies as Boolean functions of attributes for fine-grained control. - NIST SP 800-207: Zero Trust Architecture – Dynamic, JIT ARA essential. - NIST SP 800-53: AC controls. - ISO/IEC 27001: Annex A.9 Access control. - CIS Controls: Automated access provisioning. Best Practices: 1. Map attributes to roles (dept, location, time). 2. Use tools: Okta (Workflows), SailPoint (IdentityIQ), Saviynt. 3. Enforce least privilege/JIT. 4. Audit/monitor. Pitfalls: Complex policies, stale attributes, privilege creep. Real-world: Hospitals use ABAC-ARA for HIPAA-compliant patient data access.
